title: Leadership Visualization Learning Design to Improve Student Engagement in Online Science Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced scientific knowledge and experience with online learning tools
context.additional_context: Flexible group work options required for time-constrained working learners, reflecting design insights from the advantages of non-face-to-face learning during COVID-19

learning_goals: Learners improve collaborative efficiency with peer learners by over 20% by applying leadership visualization techniques during scientific problem-solving processes in a VR simulation environment.
Learners can identify and utilize personalized motivational factors (e.g., grades, tutor feedback) that induce a flow state (immersion) during online learning.
Learners quantitatively and qualitatively analyze the impact of selected group work types (individual/team) on learning outcomes through project-based assessment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
